line_text: I know him as myself; for from our infancy
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: We have conversed and spent our hours together:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And though myself have been an idle truant,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Omitting the sweet benefit of time
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To clothe mine age with angel-like perfection,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Yet hath Sir Proteus, for that's his name,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Made use and fair advantage of his days;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: His years but young, but his experience old;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: His head unmellow'd, but his judgment ripe;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And, in a word, for far behind his worth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Comes all the praises that I now bestow,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: He is complete in feature and in mind
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With all good grace to grace a gentleman.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Beshrew me, sir, but if he make this good,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: He is as worthy for an empress' love
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: As meet to be an emperor's counsellor.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Well, sir, this gentleman is come to me,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With commendation from great potentates;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And here he means to spend his time awhile:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I think 'tis no unwelcome news to you.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Should I have wish'd a thing, it had been he.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Welcome him then according to his worth.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Silvia, I speak to you, and you, Sir Thurio;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: For Valentine, I need not cite him to it:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I will send him hither to you presently.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: This is the gentleman I told your ladyship
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Had come along with me, but that his mistress
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Did hold his eyes lock'd in her crystal looks.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Belike that now she hath enfranchised them
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Upon some other pawn for fealty.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Nay, sure, I think she holds them prisoners still.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Nay, then he should be blind; and, being blind
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: How could he see his way to seek out you?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, lady, Love hath twenty pair of eyes.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: They say that Love hath not an eye at all.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To see such lovers, Thurio, as yourself:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Upon a homely object Love can wink.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Have done, have done; here comes the gentleman.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Welcome, dear Proteus! Mistress, I beseech you,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Confirm his welcome with some special favour.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: His worth is warrant for his welcome hither,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: If this be he you oft have wish'd to hear from.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Mistress, it is: sweet lady, entertain him
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To be my fellow-servant to your ladyship.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Too low a mistress for so high a servant.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Not so, sweet lady: but too mean a servant
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To have a look of such a worthy mistress.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Leave off discourse of disability:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Sweet lady, entertain him for your servant.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: My duty will I boast of; nothing else.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And duty never yet did want his meed:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Servant, you are welcome to a worthless mistress.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I'll die on him that says so but yourself.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That you are welcome?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That you are worthless.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Madam, my lord your father would speak with you.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I wait upon his pleasure. Come, Sir Thurio,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Go with me. Once more, new servant, welcome:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I'll leave you to confer of home affairs;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: When you have done, we look to hear from you.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: We'll both attend upon your ladyship.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Now, tell me, how do all from whence you came?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Your friends are well and have them much commended.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And how do yours?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I left them all in health.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: How does your lady? and how thrives your love?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: My tales of love were wont to weary you;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I know you joy not in a love discourse.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Ay, Proteus, but that life is alter'd now:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I have done penance for contemning Love,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Whose high imperious thoughts have punish'd me
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With bitter fasts, with penitential groans,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With nightly tears and daily heart-sore sighs;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: For in revenge of my contempt of love,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Love hath chased sleep from my enthralled eyes
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And made them watchers of mine own heart's sorrow.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O gentle Proteus, Love's a mighty lord,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And hath so humbled me, as, I confess,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: There is no woe to his correction,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Nor to his service no such joy on earth.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Now no discourse, except it be of love;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Now can I break my fast, dine, sup and sleep,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Upon the very naked name of love.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Enough; I read your fortune in your eye.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Was this the idol that you worship so?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Even she; and is she not a heavenly saint?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No; but she is an earthly paragon.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Call her divine.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I will not flatter her.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O, flatter me; for love delights in praises.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: When I was sick, you gave me bitter pills,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And I must minister the like to you.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Then speak the truth by her; if not divine,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Yet let her be a principality,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Sovereign to all the creatures on the earth.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Except my mistress.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Sweet, except not any;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Except thou wilt except against my love.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Have I not reason to prefer mine own?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And I will help thee to prefer her too:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: She shall be dignified with this high honour--
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To bear my lady's train, lest the base earth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Should from her vesture chance to steal a kiss
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And, of so great a favour growing proud,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Disdain to root the summer-swelling flower
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And make rough winter everlastingly.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, Valentine, what braggardism is this?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Pardon me, Proteus: all I can is nothing
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To her whose worth makes other worthies nothing;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: She is alone.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Then let her alone.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Not for the world: why, man, she is mine own,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And I as rich in having such a jewel
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: As twenty seas, if all their sand were pearl,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: The water nectar and the rocks pure gold.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Forgive me that I do not dream on thee,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Because thou see'st me dote upon my love.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: My foolish rival, that her father likes
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Only for his possessions are so huge,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Is gone with her along, and I must after,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: For love, thou know'st, is full of jealousy.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But she loves you?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Ay, and we are betroth'd: nay, more, our,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: marriage-hour,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With all the cunning manner of our flight,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Determined of; how I must climb her window,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: The ladder made of cords, and all the means
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Plotted and 'greed on for my happiness.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Good Proteus, go with me to my chamber,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: In these affairs to aid me with thy counsel.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Go on before; I shall inquire you forth:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I must unto the road, to disembark
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Some necessaries that I needs must use,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And then I'll presently attend you.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Will you make haste?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I will.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Even as one heat another heat expels,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Or as one nail by strength drives out another,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: So the remembrance of my former love
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Is by a newer object quite forgotten.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Is it mine, or Valentine's praise,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Her true perfection, or my false transgression,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That makes me reasonless to reason thus?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: She is fair; and so is Julia that I love--
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That I did love, for now my love is thaw'd;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Which, like a waxen image, 'gainst a fire,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Bears no impression of the thing it was.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Methinks my zeal to Valentine is cold,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And that I love him not as I was wont.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O, but I love his lady too too much,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And that's the reason I love him so little.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: How shall I dote on her with more advice,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That thus without advice begin to love her!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Tis but her picture I have yet beheld,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And that hath dazzled my reason's light;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But when I look on her perfections,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: There is no reason but I shall be blind.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: If I can cheque my erring love, I will;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: If not, to compass her I'll use my skill.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Launce! by mine honesty, welcome to Milan!
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Forswear not thyself, sweet youth, for I am not
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: welcome. I reckon this always, that a man is never
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: undone till he be hanged, nor never welcome to a
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: place till some certain shot be paid and the hostess
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: say 'Welcome!'
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Come on, you madcap, I'll to the alehouse with you
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: presently; where, for one shot of five pence, thou
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: shalt have five thousand welcomes. But, sirrah, how
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: did thy master part with Madam Julia?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Marry, after they closed in earnest, they parted very
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: fairly in jest.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: But shall she marry him?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: No.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: How then? shall he marry her?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: No, neither.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: What, are they broken?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: No, they are both as whole as a fish.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Why, then, how stands the matter with them?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Marry, thus: when it stands well with him, it
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: stands well with her.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: What an ass art thou! I understand thee not.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: What a block art thou, that thou canst not! My
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: staff understands me.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: What thou sayest?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Ay, and what I do too: look thee, I'll but lean,
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: and my staff understands me.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: It stands under thee, indeed.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Why, stand-under and under-stand is all one.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: But tell me true, will't be a match?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Ask my dog: if he say ay, it will! if he say no,
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: it will; if he shake his tail and say nothing, it will.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: The conclusion is then that it will.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Thou shalt never get such a secret from me but by a parable.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: 'Tis well that I get it so. But, Launce, how sayest
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: thou, that my master is become a notable lover?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: I never knew him otherwise.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Than how?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: A notable lubber, as thou reportest him to be.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Why, thou whoreson ass, thou mistakest me.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Why, fool, I meant not thee; I meant thy master.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: I tell thee, my master is become a hot lover.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Why, I tell thee, I care not though he burn himself
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: in love. If thou wilt, go with me to the alehouse;
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: if not, thou art an Hebrew, a Jew, and not worth the
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: name of a Christian.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Why?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: Because thou hast not so much charity in thee as to
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: go to the ale with a Christian. Wilt thou go?
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: At thy service.
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. A street.

line_text: To leave my Julia, shall I be forsworn;
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: To love fair Silvia, shall I be forsworn;
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: To wrong my friend, I shall be much forsworn;
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: And even that power which gave me first my oath
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Provokes me to this threefold perjury;
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Love bade me swear and Love bids me forswear.
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: O sweet-suggesting Love, if thou hast sinned,
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Teach me, thy tempted subject, to excuse it!
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: At first I did adore a twinkling star,
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: But now I worship a celestial sun.
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Unheedful vows may heedfully be broken,
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: And he wants wit that wants resolved will
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: To learn his wit to exchange the bad for better.
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Fie, fie, unreverend tongue! to call her bad,
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Whose sovereignty so oft thou hast preferr'd
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: With twenty thousand soul-confirming oaths.
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: I cannot leave to love, and yet I do;
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: But there I leave to love where I should love.
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: Julia I lose and Valentine I lose:
scene_title: SCENE VI.  The same. The DUKE'S palace.

line_text: If I keep them, I needs must lose myself;

line_text: And kept severely from resort of men,

line_text: That no man hath recourse to her by night.

line_text: And built so shelving that one cannot climb it

line_text: To cast up, with a pair of anchoring hooks,

line_text: So bold Leander would adventure it.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Now, as thou art a gentleman of blood,

line_text: Advise me where I may have such a ladder.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: When would you use it? pray, sir, tell me that.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: This very night; for Love is like a child,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That longs for every thing that he can come by.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: By seven o'clock I'll get you such a ladder.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But, hark thee; I will go to her alone:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: How shall I best convey the ladder thither?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: It will be light, my lord, that you may bear it
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Under a cloak that is of any length.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: A cloak as long as thine will serve the turn?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Ay, my good lord.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Then let me see thy cloak:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I'll get me one of such another length.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, any cloak will serve the turn, my lord.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: How shall I fashion me to wear a cloak?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I pray thee, let me feel thy cloak upon me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What letter is this same? What's here? 'To Silvia'!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And here an engine fit for my proceeding.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I'll be so bold to break the seal for once.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'My thoughts do harbour with my Silvia nightly,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And slaves they are to me that send them flying:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O, could their master come and go as lightly,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Himself would lodge where senseless they are lying!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: My herald thoughts in thy pure bosom rest them:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: While I, their king, that hither them importune,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Do curse the grace that with such grace hath bless'd them,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Because myself do want my servants' fortune:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I curse myself, for they are sent by me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That they should harbour where their lord would be.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What's here?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Silvia, this night I will enfranchise thee.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Tis so; and here's the ladder for the purpose.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, Phaeton,--for thou art Merops' son,--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Wilt thou aspire to guide the heavenly car
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And with thy daring folly burn the world?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Wilt thou reach stars, because they shine on thee?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Go, base intruder! overweening slave!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Bestow thy fawning smiles on equal mates,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And think my patience, more than thy desert,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Is privilege for thy departure hence:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Thank me for this more than for all the favours
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Which all too much I have bestow'd on thee.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But if thou linger in my territories
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Longer than swiftest expedition
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Will give thee time to leave our royal court,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: By heaven! my wrath shall far exceed the love
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I ever bore my daughter or thyself.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Be gone! I will not hear thy vain excuse;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But, as thou lovest thy life, make speed from hence.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And why not death rather than living torment?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: To die is to be banish'd from myself;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And Silvia is myself: banish'd from her
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Is self from self: a deadly banishment!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What light is light, if Silvia be not seen?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What joy is joy, if Silvia be not by?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Unless it be to think that she is by
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And feed upon the shadow of perfection
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Except I be by Silvia in the night,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: There is no music in the nightingale;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Unless I look on Silvia in the day,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: There is no day for me to look upon;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: She is my essence, and I leave to be,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: If I be not by her fair influence
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Foster'd, illumined, cherish'd, kept alive.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I fly not death, to fly his deadly doom:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Tarry I here, I but attend on death:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But, fly I hence, I fly away from life.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Run, boy, run, run, and seek him out.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Soho, soho!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What seest thou?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Him we go to find: there's not a hair on's head
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: but 'tis a Valentine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Valentine?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Who then? his spirit?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Neither.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What then?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Nothing.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Can nothing speak? Master, shall I strike?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Who wouldst thou strike?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Nothing.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Villain, forbear.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, sir, I'll strike nothing: I pray you,--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Sirrah, I say, forbear. Friend Valentine, a word.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: My ears are stopt and cannot hear good news,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: So much of bad already hath possess'd them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Then in dumb silence will I bury mine,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: For they are harsh, untuneable and bad.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Is Silvia dead?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No, Valentine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No Valentine, indeed, for sacred Silvia.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Hath she forsworn me?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No, Valentine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No Valentine, if Silvia have forsworn me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What is your news?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Sir, there is a proclamation that you are vanished.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That thou art banished--O, that's the news!--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: From hence, from Silvia and from me thy friend.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O, I have fed upon this woe already,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And now excess of it will make me surfeit.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Doth Silvia know that I am banished?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Ay, ay; and she hath offer'd to the doom--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Which, unreversed, stands in effectual force--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: A sea of melting pearl, which some call tears:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Those at her father's churlish feet she tender'd;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With them, upon her knees, her humble self;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Wringing her hands, whose whiteness so became them
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: As if but now they waxed pale for woe:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But neither bended knees, pure hands held up,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Sad sighs, deep groans, nor silver-shedding tears,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Could penetrate her uncompassionate sire;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: But Valentine, if he be ta'en, must die.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Besides, her intercession chafed him so,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: When she for thy repeal was suppliant,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That to close prison he commanded her,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With many bitter threats of biding there.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: No more; unless the next word that thou speak'st
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Have some malignant power upon my life:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: If so, I pray thee, breathe it in mine ear,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: As ending anthem of my endless dolour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Cease to lament for that thou canst not help,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And study help for that which thou lament'st.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Time is the nurse and breeder of all good.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Here if thou stay, thou canst not see thy love;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Besides, thy staying will abridge thy life.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Hope is a lover's staff; walk hence with that
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And manage it against despairing thoughts.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Thy letters may be here, though thou art hence;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Which, being writ to me, shall be deliver'd
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Even in the milk-white bosom of thy love.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: The time now serves not to expostulate:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Come, I'll convey thee through the city-gate;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And, ere I part with thee, confer at large
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Of all that may concern thy love-affairs.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: As thou lovest Silvia, though not for thyself,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Regard thy danger, and along with me!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I pray thee, Launce, an if thou seest my boy,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Bid him make haste and meet me at the North-gate.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Go, sirrah, find him out. Come, Valentine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O my dear Silvia! Hapless Valentine!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I am but a fool, look you; and yet I have the wit to
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: think my master is a kind of a knave: but that's
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: all one, if he be but one knave. He lives not now
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: that knows me to be in love; yet I am in love; but a
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: team of horse shall not pluck that from me; nor who
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'tis I love; and yet 'tis a woman; but what woman, I
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: will not tell myself; and yet 'tis a milkmaid; yet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'tis not a maid, for she hath had gossips; yet 'tis
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: a maid, for she is her master's maid, and serves for
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: wages. She hath more qualities than a water-spaniel;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: which is much in a bare Christian.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Here is the cate-log of her condition.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Imprimis: She can fetch and carry.' Why, a horse
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: can do no more: nay, a horse cannot fetch, but only
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: carry; therefore is she better than a jade. 'Item:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: She can milk;' look you, a sweet virtue in a maid
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: with clean hands.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: How now, Signior Launce! what news with your
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: mastership?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: With my master's ship? why, it is at sea.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Well, your old vice still; mistake the word. What
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: news, then, in your paper?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: The blackest news that ever thou heardest.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, man, how black?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Why, as black as ink.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Let me read them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Fie on thee, jolt-head! thou canst not read.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Thou liest; I can.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: I will try thee. Tell me this: who begot thee?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Marry, the son of my grandfather.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O illiterate loiterer! it was the son of thy
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: grandmother: this proves that thou canst not read.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Come, fool, come; try me in thy paper.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: There; and St. Nicholas be thy speed!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.
SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Ay, that she can.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Item: She brews good ale.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: And thereof comes the proverb: 'Blessing of your
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: heart, you brew good ale.'

scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That's as much as to say, Can she so?

scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: What need a man care for a stock with a wench, when
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: she can knit him a stock?

scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: A special virtue: for then she need not be washed

line_text: and scoured.

line_text: Then may I set the world on wheels, when she can

line_text: spin for her living.

line_text: indeed, know not their fathers and therefore have no names.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Close at the heels of her virtues.

line_text: of her breath.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Well, that fault may be mended with a breakfast. Read on.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Item: She hath a sweet mouth.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: That makes amends for her sour breath.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Item: She doth talk in her sleep.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: It's no matter for that, so she sleep not in her talk.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Item: She is slow in words.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: O villain, that set this down among her vices! To
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: be slow in words is a woman's only virtue: I pray
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: thee, out with't, and place it for her chief virtue.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: 'Item: She is proud.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Out with that too; it was Eve's legacy, and cannot
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: be ta'en from her.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Milan. The DUKE's palace.

line_text: Come, bring her away.
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: Where is the gentleman that was with her?
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: Being nimble-footed, he hath outrun us,
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: But Moyses and Valerius follow him.
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: Go thou with her to the west end of the wood;
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: There is our captain: we'll follow him that's fled;
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: The thicket is beset; he cannot 'scape.
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: Come, I must bring you to our captain's cave:
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: Fear not; he bears an honourable mind,
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: And will not use a woman lawlessly.
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: O Valentine, this I endure for thee!
scene_title: SCENE III.  The frontiers of Mantua. The forest.

line_text: How use doth breed a habit in a man!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: This shadowy desert, unfrequented woods,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I better brook than flourishing peopled towns:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Here can I sit alone, unseen of any,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And to the nightingale's complaining notes
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Tune my distresses and record my woes.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O thou that dost inhabit in my breast,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Leave not the mansion so long tenantless,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Lest, growing ruinous, the building fall
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And leave no memory of what it was!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Repair me with thy presence, Silvia;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou gentle nymph, cherish thy forlorn swain!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: What halloing and what stir is this to-day?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: These are my mates, that make their wills their law,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Have some unhappy passenger in chase.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: They love me well; yet I have much to do
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To keep them from uncivil outrages.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Withdraw thee, Valentine: who's this comes here?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Madam, this service I have done for you,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Though you respect not aught your servant doth,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To hazard life and rescue you from him
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: That would have forced your honour and your love;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Vouchsafe me, for my meed, but one fair look;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: A smaller boon than this I cannot beg
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And less than this, I am sure, you cannot give.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Love, lend me patience to forbear awhile.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O miserable, unhappy that I am!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But by my coming I have made you happy.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: By thy approach thou makest me most unhappy.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Had I been seized by a hungry lion,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I would have been a breakfast to the beast,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Rather than have false Proteus rescue me.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O, Heaven be judge how I love Valentine,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Whose life's as tender to me as my soul!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And full as much, for more there cannot be,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I do detest false perjured Proteus.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Therefore be gone; solicit me no more.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: What dangerous action, stood it next to death,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Would I not undergo for one calm look!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O, 'tis the curse in love, and still approved,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: When women cannot love where they're beloved!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: When Proteus cannot love where he's beloved.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Read over Julia's heart, thy first best love,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: For whose dear sake thou didst then rend thy faith
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Into a thousand oaths; and all those oaths
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Descended into perjury, to love me.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou hast no faith left now, unless thou'dst two;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And that's far worse than none; better have none
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Than plural faith which is too much by one:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou counterfeit to thy true friend!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: In love
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Who respects friend?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: All men but Proteus.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Nay, if the gentle spirit of moving words
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Can no way change you to a milder form,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I'll woo you like a soldier, at arms' end,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And love you 'gainst the nature of love,--force ye.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O heaven!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I'll force thee yield to my desire.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Ruffian, let go that rude uncivil touch,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou friend of an ill fashion!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Valentine!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou common friend, that's without faith or love,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: For such is a friend now; treacherous man!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou hast beguiled my hopes; nought but mine eye
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Could have persuaded me: now I dare not say
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I have one friend alive; thou wouldst disprove me.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Who should be trusted, when one's own right hand
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Is perjured to the bosom? Proteus,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I am sorry I must never trust thee more,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But count the world a stranger for thy sake.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The private wound is deepest: O time most accurst,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: 'Mongst all foes that a friend should be the worst!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: My shame and guilt confounds me.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Forgive me, Valentine: if hearty sorrow
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Be a sufficient ransom for offence,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I tender 't here; I do as truly suffer
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: As e'er I did commit.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Then I am paid;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And once again I do receive thee honest.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Who by repentance is not satisfied
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Is nor of heaven nor earth, for these are pleased.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: By penitence the Eternal's wrath's appeased:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And, that my love may appear plain and free,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: All that was mine in Silvia I give thee.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O me unhappy!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Look to the boy.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Why, boy! why, wag! how now! what's the matter?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Look up; speak.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O good sir, my master charged me to deliver a ring
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: to Madam Silvia, which, out of my neglect, was never done.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Where is that ring, boy?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Here 'tis; this is it.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: How! let me see:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Why, this is the ring I gave to Julia.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O, cry you mercy, sir, I have mistook:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: This is the ring you sent to Silvia.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But how camest thou by this ring? At my depart
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I gave this unto Julia.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And Julia herself did give it me;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And Julia herself hath brought it hither.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: How! Julia!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Behold her that gave aim to all thy oaths,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And entertain'd 'em deeply in her heart.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: How oft hast thou with perjury cleft the root!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O Proteus, let this habit make thee blush!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Be thou ashamed that I have took upon me
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Such an immodest raiment, if shame live
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: In a disguise of love:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: It is the lesser blot, modesty finds,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Women to change their shapes than men their minds.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Than men their minds! 'tis true.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: O heaven! were man
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: But constant, he were perfect. That one error
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Fills him with faults; makes him run through all the sins:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Inconstancy falls off ere it begins.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: What is in Silvia's face, but I may spy
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: More fresh in Julia's with a constant eye?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Come, come, a hand from either:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Let me be blest to make this happy close;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: 'Twere pity two such friends should be long foes.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Bear witness, Heaven, I have my wish for ever.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And I mine.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: A prize, a prize, a prize!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Forbear, forbear, I say! it is my lord the duke.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Your grace is welcome to a man disgraced,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Banished Valentine.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Sir Valentine!
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Yonder is Silvia; and Silvia's mine.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thurio, give back, or else embrace thy death;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Come not within the measure of my wrath;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Do not name Silvia thine; if once again,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Verona shall not hold thee. Here she stands;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Take but possession of her with a touch:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I dare thee but to breathe upon my love.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Sir Valentine, I care not for her, I;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I hold him but a fool that will endanger
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: His body for a girl that loves him not:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I claim her not, and therefore she is thine.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The more degenerate and base art thou,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To make such means for her as thou hast done
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And leave her on such slight conditions.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Now, by the honour of my ancestry,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I do applaud thy spirit, Valentine,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And think thee worthy of an empress' love:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Know then, I here forget all former griefs,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Cancel all grudge, repeal thee home again,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Plead a new state in thy unrivall'd merit,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To which I thus subscribe: Sir Valentine,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou art a gentleman and well derived;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Take thou thy Silvia, for thou hast deserved her.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I thank your grace; the gift hath made me happy.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I now beseech you, for your daughter's sake,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: To grant one boom that I shall ask of you.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I grant it, for thine own, whate'er it be.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: These banish'd men that I have kept withal
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Are men endued with worthy qualities:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Forgive them what they have committed here
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And let them be recall'd from their exile:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: They are reformed, civil, full of good
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And fit for great employment, worthy lord.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Thou hast prevail'd; I pardon them and thee:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Dispose of them as thou know'st their deserts.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Come, let us go: we will include all jars
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: With triumphs, mirth and rare solemnity.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: And, as we walk along, I dare be bold
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: With our discourse to make your grace to smile.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: What think you of this page, my lord?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I think the boy hath grace in him; he blushes.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: I warrant you, my lord, more grace than boy.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: What mean you by that saying?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Please you, I'll tell you as we pass along,
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: That you will wonder what hath fortuned.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: Come, Proteus; 'tis your penance but to hear
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: The story of your loves discovered:
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: That done, our day of marriage shall be yours;
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.

line_text: One feast, one house, one mutual happiness.
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
